column13: Telstra's social and environmental partnerships, in place for over a decade, have successfully delivered critical business objectives, community outcomes, and employment opportunities. This year, Telstra's Supported Workforce Program provided opportunities for 155 individuals to engage in cleaning and grounds maintenance activities at 5,080 sites nationwide.
column22: Social and environmental partnerships, Supported Workforce Program, employment opportunities

column13: Telstra's initiatives, including the Indigenous Workforce Program (IWP). Supported around 40 First Nations enterprises in maintenance tasks across over 1,500 regional and remote sites, with a total expenditure of $3.09 million in FY23.
column22: IWP, Indigenous Workforce Program, employment opportunities

column13: In FY23, Telstra invested over $20 million with over 30 First Nations businesses certified or registered by Supply Nation, surpassing last year's spend of $14 million. Telstra continues to develop its strategy at a category level and collaborates with strategic partners to enhance supplier diversity across its supply chain.
column22: First Nations businesses, Supply Nation, supplier diversity

column13: Telstra's Know Your Supplier platform (KYS) is a secure web-based platform targeting domestically contracted suppliers with whom Telstra engages regularly. Telstra matured its Know Your Supplier (KYS) processes in FY23 to enhance governance of supplier risk and increase the number of suppliers onboarded via KYS, with 1,204 suppliers onboarded as of June 30 2023, up from 1,055 in FY22.
column22: Know Your Supplier, Governance, Supplier Risk

column13: Telstra delivers digital literacy programs with its community partners to empower people of all ages and backgrounds to utilize technology safely and responsibly. Collectively, Telstra's digital literacy initiatives have supported over 200,000 Australians in FY23 and over 250,000 in the past two years, aligning with its T25 target to enhance digital skills for 500,000 Australians by FY25.
column22: Digital literacy program, community partners, tech skills

column13: Telstra is committed to helping those facing cost-of-living pressure by continuing to offer a range of products, services and programs to improve digital inclusion outcomes for our customers and communities. Telstra supports communities by offering discounted services for low-income individuals, aiding victims of domestic violence, providing free crisis line calls, offering free Wi-Fi at Telstra payphones, and providing disaster relief.

Celebrating two decades of social innovation enabled by tech. For over 20 years, Telstra Foundation, our registered Australian charity, has supported Australian initiatives focussed on youth education, mental health and inclusion.

column8: Resource usage and waste reduction strategy
column13: Telstra's strategy emphasizes resource usage and waste reduction across operations, manufacturing, distribution, and product lifecycle. This initiative showcases Telstra's commitment to sustainability leadership, benefiting the company and its customers, suppliers, contractors, and partners.

Telstra enhanced its Know Your Supplier (KYS) processes in FY23 to improve governance of supplier risk and onboard more suppliers through KYS. By June 30, 2023, Telstra had onboarded 1,204 suppliers on the KYS platform, with 53% completing the KYS Questionnaire, up from 38% in FY22.
column22: Know Your Supplier, Governance, Supplier Risk

column13: In FY23, Telstra integrated Telstra's scope 1+2 absolute emissions reduction target into Telstra's Executive Variable Remuneration Plan, linking it to senior executive short-term incentives and acknowledging its significance to Telstra's success and the role of each team member.
column22: Emissions Reduction, Executive Remuneration, Performance Measures

column13: Telstra customers can now return their old modems for free through Telstra's newly launched modem eParcel returns initiative. Telstra refurbishes and recycles Smart Modem 2 and 3 units, processing 15,008 modems in FY23.

column13: Telstra is dedicated to resource optimization, waste reduction, and circular solutions for sustainability. In October 2022, Telstra achieved its goal of 100% renewable/recycled Telstra-branded packaging two months earlier than planned.

column13: Telstra is implementing a large-scale initiative to replace over 100,000 old fluorescent lights across its facilities with energy-efficient LED lights featuring motion sensors. Since 2020, Telstra has removed 127,760 fluorescent lights and replaced them with 64,630 LED fittings, reducing energy consumption by 23,522MWh annually.
column22: LED Lights, Energy Efficiency, Environmental Impact

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
column7: Telstra's annualised emissions savings resulting from project initiatives were 23.485 (tCO2e/yr), including HVAC optimisation, building service energy efficiency upgrades, LED lighting, and upgrading rectifiers.

column13: As the climate changes, Telstra is seeing increasingly frequent severe weather events. Connectivity and technology solutions are vital to monitoring weather and planning and effectively responding to natural disasters. Telstra's infrastructure can also offer access pathways to remote parts of the country to help respond to bushfires and other events.
